gr.forth.ics.graph.algo
Class KCoreDecomposition

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.graph.algo.KCoreDecomposition

public class KCoreDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object

K-core node partitioning of a graph.

See Also:
K-Core article on Wikipedia, "S. B. Seidman, 1983, Network structure and minimum degree, Social Networks 5:269-287"

Method Summary
static KCoreDecomposition execute(InspectableGraph g)
          Creates a K-core decomposition for the specified graph.
 java.util.Set<Node> getCore(int kcore)
          Returns the set of nodes of the specified k-core, or an empty set (but not null) if there is no such core.
 java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<Node>> getCores()
          Returns all non-empty cores indexed by their "k" index.

Returns all non-empty cores indexed by their "k" index.

Returns:

getCore

public java.util.Set<Node> getCore(int kcore)
Returns the set of nodes of the specified k-core, or an empty set (but not null) if there is no such core.

Parameters:
kcore - the core to return
Returns:
the nodes of core specified, or an empty set if there is no such core
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kcore < 1

execute

public static KCoreDecomposition execute(InspectableGraph g)
Creates a K-core decomposition for the specified graph. The graph remains unmodified.

Parameters:
g - the graph for which to create the K-core decomposition
Returns:
the K-core decomposition
